paper_abstract: Given a real finite hyperplane arrangement and a point not on any of the hyperplanes, we define an arrangement , called the valid order arrangement, whose regions correspond to the different orders in which a line through can cross the hyperplanes in . If is the set of affine spans of the facets of a convex polytope and lies in the interior of , then the valid orderings with respect to are just the line shellings of where the shelling line contains . When is sufficiently generic, the intersection lattice of is the Dilworth truncation of the semicone of . Various applications and examples are given. For instance, we determine the maximum number of line shellings of a -polytope with facets when the shelling line contains a fixed point . If is the order polytope of a poset, then the sets of facets visible from a point involve a generalization of chromatic polynomials related to list colorings.
paper_title: Valid Orderings of Real Hyperplane Arrangements
